intro: Colchicum haussknechtii, commonly known as the Haussknecht's colchicum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Colchicaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces large, lance-shaped leaves and has a corm-like structure for storage. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
